findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE Employee must maintain strict confidentiality of all research data, proprietary methods, and trade secrets indefinitely, without any time limitation....
findings.exact_snippet: CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE Employee must maintain strict confidentiality of all research data, proprietary methods, and trade secrets indefinitely
findings.context:
l inventions, discoveries, and intellectual property created by Employee during employment shall be the exclusive property of Employer. Employee hereby irrevocably assigns all such rights to Employer.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE
Employee must maintain strict confidentiality of all research data, proprietary methods, and trade secrets indefinitely, without any time limitation.

5. NON-COMPETE AND NON-SOLICITATION
Employee shall not engage in competitive research or solicit Employer's research partners for 3 years following termination.

findings.title: Non-compete / non-solicit style restriction
findings.rationale: Restrictive covenants can limit future business activity; enforceability varies and is commonly negotiated.

findings.title: Specific governing law or venue
findings.rationale: Governing law and venue choices can affect enforcement cost and strategy.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...10. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement is governed by California law, and the parties consent to exclusive jurisdiction in California courts....

an Arbitration Association.

9. ATTORNEYS' FEES
Employer shall be entitled to recover all attorneys' fees, court costs, and expenses from Employee in any enforcement action.

10. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement is governed by California law, and the parties consent to exclusive jurisdiction in California courts.

This Agreement is effective as of February 1, 2025.

changes: Added 8 high-signal rules (attorneys fees, liability cap carveouts, assignment restrictions, etc.)
Implemented clause-level anchoring and false-positive suppression
